messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] What is unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Wow, Ned.  You must not have read the same posts I read.  Now, I get mine on digest, in Europe, so my concept of days doesn t look quite like yours,
messages.messageBody:
> When was the last time anyone posted something here that was actually about
> UNschooling? I can't remember it.

Wow, Ned. You must not have read the same posts I read. Now, I get mine on
digest, in Europe, so my concept of "days" doesn't look quite like yours,
perhaps. But today, and in the last couple days, I've read several people's
comments on how they know unschooling is working for them, posted in
response to a request by someone. I've participated in a discussion about
homeschooling and unschooling in the military, and in states with somewhat
more iritating laws. And I've read some interesting comments on Rap, which
I know absolutely nothing about, which have been enlightening and also
somewhat iritating.

Ned, I like this list. I don't consider myself an old-timer, since I've
been here since March or April (I forget which). But I have enjoyed the
diversity of subjects and the diversity of opinions. If you don't like the
owner or the moderator, then by all means leave. However, if you stay,
please stop complaining. It's not attractive in children, and it's no
better when the "child" is over 40.

brenda
